TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SoapExtensionImporter extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a common interface and functionality for classes to generate code attributes that specify SOAP extensions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionImporter>`abstract` class exposes an `abstract` method, <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionImporter.ImportMethod%2A>, which allows a derived class to add metadata to any method that represents an operation in a binding. The method itself is not an input method. The code attributes, which are added to all Web methods in a binding class, represent extensions to the SOAP Web services protocol, for example, for adding extra headers to an outgoing SOAP message or doing extra processing on an incoming SOAP message.
You can use a class derived from <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionImporter>to extend the generation of client proxy code or `abstract` server code. You can use such a derived class in conjunction with a class derived from the `abstract`<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension> class, which extends run-time processing of SOAP messages on the client or service.
You can specify <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionImporter> in a configuration file through the `soapExtensionImporterTypes` configuration element and its child `add` element. You can apply the configuration to:
- An ASP.NET Web application: service or client.
- A stand-alone .NET Framework application: client only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the instance that invokes the method.
Docs.value: The instance that invokes the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapProtocolImporter> object maintains references to instances of <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionImporter> derived types, and then calls the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionImporter.ImportMethod%2A>on each of those instances.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ImportMethod(class System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclarationCollection metadata) cil managed

Docs.param: A into which the method can place new instances.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, adds code attribute declarations to any method that represents an operation in a binding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The method to which the attribute declarations are applied is not used directly by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.SoapExtensionImporter.ImportMethod%2A> method. The attributes are added to all Web methods in a binding class.
